dta.Time¶

class Time(hour, minute, second=0)¶

Bases: datetime.time

Class that represents a time (without a specific date). Adds a few simple methods to the standard python datetime.time class.

__init__(hour, minute, second=0)¶

Methods

__init__(hour, minute[, second])
dst Return self.tzinfo.dst(self).
fromMinutes(minutes) Return a Time object that has the same number of minutes and the input arguments
fromSeconds(seconds) Return a Time object that assuming seconds represents seconds after midnight.
getMinutes() Return the number of minutes from 0:00AM that
isoformat Return string in ISO 8601 format, HH:MM:SS[.mmmmmm][+HH:MM].
readFromString(timeAsString) Read a string representing time in the format %H:%M or %H:%M:%S e.g. 16:30
readFromStringWithoutColon(timeAsString) Read a string representing time in the format %H:%M e.g. 1630
replace Return time with new specified fields.
strftime format -> strftime() style string.
tzname Return self.tzinfo.tzname(self).
utcoffset Return self.tzinfo.utcoffset(self).

dst()¶

Return self.tzinfo.dst(self).

classmethod fromMinutes(minutes)¶

Return a Time object that has the same number of minutes and the input arguments

classmethod fromSeconds(seconds)¶

Return a Time object that assuming seconds represents seconds after midnight.

getMinutes()¶

Return the number of minutes from 0:00AM that correspond to the hours and minutes of this object.

hour¶
isoformat()¶

Return string in ISO 8601 format, HH:MM:SS[.mmmmmm][+HH:MM].

classmethod readFromString(timeAsString)¶

Read a string representing time in the format %H:%M or %H:%M:%S e.g. 16:30 and return a time object

Read a string representing time in the format %H:%M e.g. 1630 and return a time object
